changeLog.log: Template update: Add group "Mandatory User Profile" for optimizing mandatory user profile
Template update: Correct item "Do not allow the BITS client to use Windows Branch Cache" registry key
Bug fix: DISM commands missing /NoRestart switch
Template update: remove apps support for current user and new users.
Template update: 1. Scheduled Tasks\DiskCleanup\SilentCleanup disabled. 2.Scheduled Tasks\Servicing\StartComponentCleanup disabled
Template update: correct the 'Micrsoft' spelling on the item comment
Template update: add item "Device Association Service", set the service startup type to manual.
Add item "SMB v1" to disable SMB(Server Message Block) v1 at group "Disable Features". Note: Don't optimize the item if you used SMB v1.
1.Default unselected "Remove Windows Desktop Update Setup" 2.Delete "Remove Mail" item because "Remove Communications Apps" item will remove the mail app
Some UI style optimization items are not selected by default

1.Template update: "Change Explorer Default View" has been changed to unselected by default, because of conflict to UEM. Details: it causes the locations in "user files" (desktop ,downloads ,favorites ,music ,videos , Documents, Pictures) folder is to the local drive c:\Users\Username, its Should be \\server\folder_redirection\%username% when use UEM folder redirection.. 2.Template update: Add items "Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Internet Explorer", "Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Office 2010" "Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Office 2016/2013" to disable hardware acceleration if there's no hardware GPU. 3.Template update: "Previous Versions Capability" has been changed to unselected by default. because of many organizations use previous versions to allow users to restore older version of files

1. Default unselect "First Login Animation" item, optimize the item will increase login time. 2. Default unselect "Secure socket tunneling protocol service","Application layer gateway service" and "SSDP Discovery". 3. Update Windows 10 template from beta to release.

group.name: Modifications to Standard Image
group.description: Select "Disable" in the Options tab of any Task to bypass processing. Disable this entire section in the same manner.

group.name: Apply HKEY_USERS\temp(Default user profile) Settings to Registry
group.description: Apply HKEY_USERS\temp(Default user profile) Settings to Registry

step.name: Load HKCU for editing
step.description: Open HKey Users (Default User Profile) for Editing

step.name: Change Explorer Default View
step.description: Change explorer default view to Thic PC. Don't optimize the item when you use VMware User Environment Manager(UEM) folder redirection.

step.name: Cursor Blink
step.description: Disable cursor blink.

step.name: Cursor Blink Rate
step.description: Not set cursor blink rate.

step.name: Default Printer
step.description: Set default printer to Print&Share.

step.name: Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Internet Explorer
step.description: Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Internet Explorer if there's no hardware GPU

condition.query: SELECT Name FROM Win32_DisplayControllerConfiguration WHERE Not Name = 'VMware SVGA 3D'

step.name: Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Office 2010
step.description: Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Office 2010 if there's no hardware GPU

condition.query: SELECT Name FROM Win32_DisplayControllerConfiguration WHERE Not Name = 'VMware SVGA 3D'

step.name: Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Office 2016/2013
step.description: Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Office 2016/2013 if there's no hardware GPU

condition.query: SELECT Name FROM Win32_DisplayControllerConfiguration WHERE Not Name = 'VMware SVGA 3D'

step.name: Group policy - Do not add shares of recently opened documents to Network Locations
step.description: Enable this policy, shared folders are not added to Network Locations automatically when you open a document in the shared folder.

step.name: Group policy - Maximum size of Active Directory searches
step.description: Enable this policy, set Number of objects returned to 5000.

step.name: Group policy - Clear the recent programs list for new users
step.description: Enable this policy, the recent programs list in the start menu will be blank for each new user.

step.name: Group policy - Do not display or track items in Jump Lists from remote locations
step.description: Enable this policy, the Start Menu and Taskbar only track the files that the user opens locally on this computer. Files that the user opens over the network from remote computers are not tracked or shown in the Jump Lists. Use this setting to reduce network traffic, particularly over slow network connections.

step.name: Group policy - Turn off all balloon notifications
step.description: Enable this policy, no notification balloons are shown to the user.

step.name: Group policy - Turn off user tracking
step.description: Enable this policy, the system does not track the programs that the user runs, and does not display frequently used programs in the Start Menu.

step.name: Group policy - Turn off toast notifications
step.description: Enable this policy, applications will not be able to raise toast notifications.

step.name: Group policy - Turn off all Windows spotlight features
step.description: Enable this policy, Windows spotlight on lock screen, Windows tips, Microsoft consumer features and other related features will be turned off.

step.name: Group policy - Turn off caching of thumbnail pictures
step.description: Enable this policy, thumbnail views are not cached.

step.name: Group policy - Turn off display of recent search entries in the File Explorer search box
step.description: Enable this policy, File Explorer will not show suggestion pop-ups as users type into the Search Box, and it will not store Search Box entries into the registry for future references.

step.name: Group policy - Turn off the caching of thumbnails in hidden thumbs.db file
step.description: Enable this policy, File Explorer does not create, read from, or write to thumbs.db files.

step.name: Lock Screen Title Migrate
step.description: Disable lock screen title migrate.

step.description: Disable key stroke delay.

step.description: Disable Shell - FamilySafetyRefreshTask

step.name: Shell - IndexerAutomaticMaintenance
step.description: Disable Shell - IndexerAutomaticMaintenance

step.name: System Restore Schedule
step.description: Disable System Restore Schedule

step.name: TPM - Tpm-Maintenance
step.description: Disable TPM - Tpm-Maintenance

step.name: UPnP - UPnPHostConfig
step.description: Disable UPnP - UPnPHostConfig

step.name: WDI - ResolutionHost
step.description: Disable WDI - ResolutionHost

step.name: Windows Defender Cache Maintenance
step.description: Disable Windows Defender Cache Maintenance

step.name: Windows Defender Cleanup
step.description: Disable Windows Defender Cleanup

step.name: Windows Defender Scheduled Scan
step.description: Disable Windows Defender Scheduled Scan

step.name: Windows Defender Verification
step.description: Disable Windows Defender Verification

step.name: Windows Error Reporting
step.description: Disable Windows Error Reporting

step.name: Windows Filtering Platform - BfeonServiceStartTypeChange
step.description: Disable BfeonServiceStartTypeChange

step.name: Windows Media Sharing - UpdateLibrary
step.description: Disable Windows Media Sharing - UpdateLibrary

step.name: WIM-Hash-Management
step.description: Disable WIM-Hash-Management

step.name: WIM-Hash-Validation
step.description: Disable WIM-Hash-Validation

step.name: XblGameSave Standby Task - XblGameSaveTask
step.description: Disable XblGameSave Standby Task - XblGameSaveTask

step.name: .NET Framework NGEN v4.0.30319
step.description: Disable .NET Framework NGEN v4.0.30319

step.name: .NET Framework NGEN v4.0.30319 64
step.description: Disable .NET Framework NGEN v4.0.30319 64

step.name: Verifies appUriHandler host registrations.
step.description: Disable verifies appUriHandler host registrations.

step.name: Performs maintenance for the DataSharingService.
step.description: Disable performs maintenance for the Data Sharing Service.

step.name: Disk footprint diagnostics
step.description: Disable disk footprint diagnostics

step.name: DiskFootprint StorageSense
step.description: Disable StorageSense

step.name: Scanning for updates as user
step.description: Disable Scanning for updates as User

step.name: Maintenance Install
step.description: Disable Maintenance Install

step.name: QueueReporting
step.description: Disable QueueReporting

step.name: SpeechModelDownloadTask
step.description: Disable SpeechModelDownloadTask

step.name: OneDrive Standalone Update Task
step.description: Deletes OneDrive Standalone Update Task

step.name: AllJoyn Router Service
step.description: Used for WiFi

step.name: Application Layer Gateway Service
step.description: Provides support for 3rd party protocol plug-ins for Internet Connection Sharing.

step.name: Background Intelligent Transfer Service
step.description: Transfers files in the background using idle network bandwidth. If the service is disabled, Windows Update and MSN Explorer cannot automatically download programs and other information.

step.name: Block Level Backup Engine Service
step.description: Used by Windows Backup

step.name: Bluetooth Handsfree Service
step.description: Enables wireless Bluetooth headsets to run on this computer. If this service is stopped or disabled, then Bluetooth headsets will not function properly with this machine.

step.name: Bluetooth Support Service
step.description: The Bluetooth service supports discovery and association of remote Bluetooth devices.

step.name: Bitlocker Drive Encryption Service
step.description: Bitlocker service for drive encryption. Not recommended to encrypt VDI virtual machines.

step.name: BranchCache
step.description: Used for caching files on server in a branch office.

step.name: Computer Browser
step.description: Used for browsing computers on the same network.

step.name: Delivery Optimization
step.description: Performs content delivery optimization tasks.

step.name: Device Association Service
step.description: Enables pairing between the system and wired or wireless devices. Set it startup type to manual.

step.name: Device Setup Manager
step.description: Enables the detection, download and installation of device-related software. If this service is disabled, devices may be configured with outdated software, and may not work correctly.

step.name: Diagnostic Policy Service
step.description: Disable Diagnostic Policy Service

step.name: Diagnostic Service Host
step.description: Problem detection and troubleshooting resolution.

step.name: Diagnostic System Host
step.description: Problem detection and troubleshooting resolution.

step.name: Diagnostics Tracking Service
step.description: Data collection about functional issues in Windows components. Enabled with update https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/3080149

step.name: Distributed Link Tracking Client
step.description: Disable Distributed Link Tracking Client Service

step.name: Downloaded Maps Manager
step.description: Windows service for application access to downloaded maps. This service is started on-demand by application accessing downloaded maps. Disabling this service will prevent apps from accessing maps.

step.name: Encrypting File System(EFS) Service
step.description: Provides the core file encryption technology used to store encrypted files on NTFS file system volumes. If this service is stopped or disabled, applications will be unable to access encrypted files.

step.name: Fax
step.description: Enables you to send and receive faxes, utilizing fax resources available on this computer or on the network.

step.name: Function Discovery Provider Host
step.description: The FDPHOST service hosts the Function Discovery (FD) network discovery providers. These FD providers supply network discovery services for the Simple Services Discovery Protocol (SSDP) and Web Services - Discovery (WS-D) protocol.

step.name: Function Discovery Resource Publication
step.description: Publishes his computer and resources attached to this computer so they can be discovered over the network.

step.name: HomeGroup Listener
step.description: Used for Homegroup services - N/A for VDI

step.name: HomeGroup Provider
step.description: Used for Homegroup services - N/A for VDI

step.name: Hyper-V Data Exchange Service
step.description: Allows data exchange between virtual machine and operating system running on physical host machine.

step.name: Hyper-V Guest Service Interface
step.description: Provides an interface for the Hyper-V host to interact with specific services running inside the virtual

step.name: Hyper-V Guest Shutdown Service
step.description: Facilitates shutdown of the virtual machine from the management interface on the physical computer.

step.name: Hyper-V Heartbeat Service vmicheartbeat
step.description: Monitors the state of the virtual machine by reporting a heartbeat at regular intervals.

step.name: Hyper-V Remote Desktop Virtualization Service
step.description: Provides a platform for communication between the virtual machine and operating system running on the physical computer.

step.name: Hyper-V Time Synchronization Service
step.description: Synchronizes system time of the virtual machine with the system time of the physical computer.

step.name: Hyper-V VM Session Service
step.description: Provides a mechanism to manage virtual machine with PowerShell via VM session without a virtual network.

step.name: Hyper-V Volume Shadow Copy Requestor
step.description: Coordinates the communications that are required to use Volume Shadow Copy Service to back up applications and data on the virtual machine from the operating system on the physical computer.

step.name: Interactive Services Detection
step.description: Displays a dialog box when a service tries to send a message to the console.

step.name: Internet Connection Sharing (ICS)
step.description: Provides network address translation, addressing, name resolution and/or intrusion prevention services for a home or small office network.

step.name: IP Helper
step.description: Disable if IPv6 is not a factor in VDI

step.name: Microsoft (R) Diagnostics Hub Standard Collector Service
step.description: Diagnostics Hub Standard Collector Service. When running, this service collects real time ETW events and processes them.

step.name: Microsoft iSCSI Initiator Service
step.description: Not leveraged in a VDI

step.name: Microsoft Software Shadow Copy Provider
step.description: Leveraged by Windows Backup and System Restore.

step.name: Offline Files
step.description: Disable Offline Files

step.name: Offline Files Driver
step.description: Disable Offline Files Driver

step.name: Optimize Drives
step.description: Provides Drive Optimization Capabilities.

step.name: Payments and NFC/SE Manager Service
step.description: Disable Payments and NFC/SE Manager Service

step.name: Program Compatibility Assistant Service
step.description: This service provides support for the Program Compatibility Assistant (PCA).

step.name: Quality Windows Audio Video Experience
step.description: It is a networking platform for Audio Video (AV) streaming applications on IP home networks.

step.name: Reports and Solutions Control Panel Support
step.description: Provides support for viewing, sending and deletion of system-level problem reports for the Problem Reports and Solutions control panel.

step.name: Retail Demo Service
step.description: The Retail Demo service controls device activity while the device is in retail demo mode.

step.name: Secure Socket Tunneling Protocol Service
step.description: VPN tunneling service. Not likely leveraged in a VDI environment.

step.name: Security Center
step.description: Remove the task tray regarding security center warnings

step.name: Sensor Data Service
step.description: Delivers data from a variety of sensors.

step.name: Sensor Monitoring Service
step.description: If this service is stopped or disabled, the display brightness will not adapt to lighting conditions.

step.name: Sensor Service
step.description: If this service is stopped or disabled, the SDO sensor will not be loaded and so auto-rotation will not occur. History collection from Sensors will also be stopped.

step.name: Shell Hardware Detection
step.description: If you enjoy the auto play function of CD’s and DVD’s after inserting them into your drive, leave this service on Automatic.

step.name: SNMP Trap
step.description: If this service is stopped, SNMP-based programs on this computer will not receive SNMP trap messages. If this service is disabled, any services that explicitly depend on it will fail to start.

step.name: Spot Verifier
step.description: Verifies potential file system corruptions.

step.name: SSDP Discovery
step.description: Disable SSDP Discovery

step.name: Still Image Acquisition Events
step.description: Launches applications associated with still image acquisition events.

step.name: Store Storage Service
step.description: Provides enabling services for storage settings and external storage expansion.

step.name: Superfetch
step.description: Service is leveraged to optimize loading of applications over time. In a non persistent or commodity based VDI environment this service may impact performance. Depends on use and organization.

step.name: Telephony
step.description: Provides Telephony API (TAPI) support for programs that control telephony devices on the local computer and, through the LAN.

step.name: Themes
step.description: Disable if you want to run "Classic" GUI

step.name: Universal PnP Host Service
step.description: Dependent on the SSDP Service.

step.name: Volume Shadow Copy Service
step.description: Used for System Restore and Backup Operations. (VMware product compatibility: Do not disable if Persona Management is in use.)

step.name: WAP Push Message Routing Service
step.description: WAP Push Message Routing Service.

step.name: Windows Backup
step.description: Windows Backup service used by System Restore and Windows Backups.

step.name: Windows Biometric Service
step.description: If Fingerprint devices will be used, don't optimize the item.

step.name: Windows Color System
step.description: Disabled third-party Windows Color System color device model and gamut map model plug-in modules.

step.name: Windows Connect Now - Config Registrar
step.description: This is used to configure Wireless LAN settings for an Access Point (AP) or a Wi-Fi Device.

step.name: Windows Error Reporting Service
step.description: Error reporting services leveraged by Applications when they crash to send reports to Microsoft. If using DER within VDI consider alternate configuration.

step.name: Windows Media Center Network Sharing Service
step.description: Used by Media Center

step.name: Windows Mobile Hotspot Service
step.description: Provides the ability to share a cellular data connection with another device.

step.name: Windows Search
step.description: If you do a lot of searching on a VM, do not disable this service.

step.name: Windows Update
step.description: If this is a non persistent VM, Windows Update should be handled differently via standard image maintenance practices.

step.name: WLAN AutoConfig
step.description: Wireless LAN Configuration - N/A for VDI environments.

step.name: WWAN AutoConfig
step.description: Service related to Mobile Broadband Devices

step.name: Xbox Live Auth Manager
step.description: Provides the ability to share a cellular data connection with another device.

step.name: Xbox Live Game Save
step.description: This service syncs save data for Xbox Live save enabled games.

step.name: Xbox Live Networking Service
step.description: This service supports the Windows.Networking.XboxLive applicationprogramming interface.

step.name: AVCTP service
step.description: This is Audio Video Control Transport Protocol service

step.name: Bluetooth Audio Gateway Service
step.description: Service supporting the audio gateway role of the Bluetooth Handsfree Profile.

step.name: Data Usage
step.description: Network data usage, data limit, restrict background data, metered networks.

step.name: Parental Controls
step.description: Enforces parental controls for child accounts in Windows. If this service is stopped or disabled, parental controls may not be enforced.

step.name: Volumetric Audio Compositor Service
step.description: Hosts spatial analysis for Mixed Reality audio simulation.

step.name: Xbox Accessory Management Service
step.description: This service manages connected Xbox Accessories.

group.name: Disable UAC
group.description: Disable User Access Control. Use Group Policy to configure more granularly

step.name: EnableUAC
step.description: Set EnableUAC value to 0.

step.name: ConsentPromptBehaviorAdmin
step.description: Set ConsentPromptBehaviorAdmin value to 5

step.name: ConsentPromptBehaviorUser
step.description: Set ConsentPromptBehaviorUser value to 3

step.name: Do not allow the BITS client to use Windows Branch Cache
step.description: Enable this policy, BITS client does not use Windows Branch Cache.

step.name: Do not allow the computer to act as a BITS Peercaching client
step.description: Enable this policy, the computer no longer use the BITS peer caching feature to download files.

step.name: Do not allow the computer to act as a BITS Peercaching server
step.description: Enable this policy, the computer no longer cache downloaded files and offer them to its peers.

step.name: Allow BITS Peercaching
step.description: Disable this policy, BITS will download files directly from the origin server.

step.name: Turn on BranchCache
step.description: Disable this policy, turn off BranchCache for all client computers where the policy is applied.

step.name: Enable Hotspot Authentication
step.description: Disable this policy, WLAN hotspots are not probed for WISPr protocol support, and users can only authenticate with WLAN hotspots using a web browser.

step.name: Turn off Microsoft Peer-to-Peer Networking Services
step.description: Enable this policy, Turn off peer-to-peer protocols.

step.name: Allow or Disallow use of the Offline Files feature
step.description: Disable this policy, Offline Files is disabled ,users cannot enable it.

step.name: Do not send a Windows error report when a generic driver is installed on a device
step.description: Enable this policy, an error report is not sent when a generic driver is installed.

step.name: Prevent creation of a system restore point during device activity that would normally prompt creation of a restore point
step.description: Enable this policy, Windows does not create a system restore point when one would normally be created.

step.name: Prevent device metadata retrieval from the Internet
step.description: Enable this policy, Windows does not retrieve device metadata for installed devices from the Internet.

step.name: Prevent Windows from sending an error report when a device driver requests additional software during installation
step.description: Enable this Policy, Windows does not send an error report to request additional software even if this is specified by the device driver.

step.name: Turn off "Found New Hardware" balloons during device installation
step.description: Enable this policy, "Found New Hardware" balloons do not appear while a device is being installed.

step.name: Turn off Event Viewer "Events.asp" links
step.description: Enable this policy, event description hyperlinks are not activated and the text "More Information" is not displayed at the end of the description.

step.name: Turn off handwriting personalization data sharing
step.description: Enable this policy, Tablet PC users cannot choose to share writing samples from the handwriting recognition personalization tool with Microsoft.

step.name: Turn off handwriting recognition error reporting
step.description: Enable this policy, users cannot start the handwriting recognition error reporting tool or send error reports to Microsoft.

step.name: Turn off Help and Support Center "Did you know?" content
step.description: Enable this policy, Help and Support Center no longer retrieves nor displays "Did you know?" content.

step.name: Turn off Help and Support Center Microsoft Knowledge Base search
step.description: Enable this policy, it removes the Knowledge Base section from the Help and Support Center "Set search options" page, and only Help content on the local computer is searched.

step.name: Turn off Internet Connection Wizard if URL connection is referring to Microsoft.com
step.description: Enable this policy, the "Choose a list of Internet Service Providers" path in the Internet Connection Wizard causes the wizard to exit. This prevents users from retrieving the list of ISPs, which resides on Microsoft servers.

step.name: Turn off Internet download for Web publishing and online ordering wizards
step.description: Enable this policy, Windows does not download providers, and only the service providers that are cached in the local registry are displayed.

step.name: Turn off Internet File Association service
step.description: Enable this policy, the link and the dialog for using the Web service to open an unhandled file association are removed.

step.name: Turn off Registration if URL connection is referring to Microsoft.com
step.description: Enable this policy, it blocks users from connecting to Microsoft.com for online registration and users cannot register their copy of Windows online.

step.name: Turn off the "Order Prints" picture task
step.description: Enable this policy, the task "Order Prints Online" is removed from Picture Tasks in File Explorer folders.

step.name: Turn off the "Publish to Web" task for files and folders
step.description: Enable this policy, these tasks are removed from the File and Folder tasks in Windows folders.

step.name: Turn off the Windows Messenger Customer Experience Improvement Program
step.description: Enable this policy, these tasks are removed from the File and Folder tasks in Windows folders.

step.name: Turn off Windows Customer Experience Improvement Program
step.description: Enable this policy, all users are opted out of the Windows Customer Experience Improvement Program.

step.name: Turn off Windows Error Reporting
step.description: Enable this policy, users are not given the option to report errors.

step.name: Turn off Windows Update device driver searching
step.description: Enable this policy, Windows Update is not searched when a new device is installed.

step.name: Turn off app notifications on the lock screen
step.description: No app notifications are displayed on the lock screen.

step.name: Select an active power plan
step.description: Enable this policy, specify the High Performance power plan.

step.name: Allow restore of system to default state
step.description: Enable this policy, allow the user to restore the computer to the original state or from a user-created system image.

step.name: Don't allow downloading updates to the Disk Failure Prediction Model
step.description: Updates would not be downloaded for the Disk Failure Prediction Failure Model.

step.name: Configure Scheduled Maintenance Behavior
step.description: Disable this policy, Windows will not be able to detect, troubleshoot or resolve problems on a scheduled basis.

step.name: Disable scheduled diagnostics
step.description: Windows will not be able to detect, troubleshoot or resolve problems on a scheduled basis.

step.name: Configure Scenario Execution Level
step.description: Disable this policy, Windows will not be able to detect, troubleshoot or resolve any Windows Boot Performance problems that are handled by the DPS.

step.name: Disable Windows Boot Performance Diagnostics(1/2)
step.description: Windows cannot detect, troubleshoot, and attempt to resolve automatically Windows Boot Performance Diagnostics problems that are handled by the DPS.

step.name: Disable Windows Boot Performance Diagnostics(2/2)
step.description: Windows cannot detect, troubleshoot, and attempt to resolve automatically Windows Boot Performance Diagnostics problems that are handled by the DPS.

step.name: Configure Scenario Execution Level
step.description: Disable this policy, the DPS is not able to diagnose memory leak problems.

group.name: Windows Resource Exhaustion Detection and Resolution
group.description: Windows Resource Exhaustion Detection and Resolution.

step.name: Configure Scenario Execution Level
step.description: Disable this policy, Windows will not be able to detect, troubleshoot or resolve any Windows Resource Exhaustion problems that are handled by the DPS.

step.name: Configure Scenario Execution Level
step.description: Disable this policy, Windows will not be able to detect, troubleshoot or resolve any Windows Shutdown Performance problems that are handled by the DPS.

step.name: Configure Scenario Execution Level
step.description: Disable this policy, Windows will not be able to detect, troubleshoot or resolve any Windows Standby/Resume Performance problems that are handled by the DPS.

step.name: Disable Windows Standby/Resume Performance Diagnostics
step.description: Windows cannot detect, troubleshoot, and attempt to resolve automatically Windows Standby/Resume Performance Diagnostics problems that are handled by the DPS.

step.name: Configure Scenario Execution Level
step.description: Disable this policy, Windows will not be able to detect, troubleshoot or resolve any Windows Standby/Resume Performance problems that are handled by the DPS.

step.name: Lower Scenario Execution Level
step.description: Windows cannot detect, troubleshoot, and attempt to resolve automatically any heap corruption problems that are handled by the DPS.

group.name: Start Menu and Taskbar (Policies for computer)

step.name: Turn off notifications network usage
step.description: Applications and system features will not be able receive notifications from the network from WNS or via notification polling APIs.

step.name: Prevent the wizard from running.
step.description: Enable this policy.

step.name: Set the default behavior for AutoRun
step.description: Enable this policy, Do not execute any autorun commands.

step.name: Do not show Windows tips
step.description: Enable this policy, users will no longer see Windows tips.

step.name: Turn off Microsoft consumer experiences
step.description: Enable this policy, users will no longer see personalized recommendations from Microsoft and notifications about their Microsoft account.

step.name: Cloud Content
step.description: Disable Cloud Content

step.name: Disable pre-release features or settings
step.description: Disable this policy, all experimentations will be turned off.

step.name: Do not show feedback notifications
step.description: Enable this policy, users will no longer see feedback notifications through the Windows Feedback app.

step.name: Toggle user control over Insider builds
step.description: Disable this policy, Windows Insider Program settings will be unavailable to users through the Settings app.

step.name: Quit Microsoft MAPS
step.description: You will not join Microsoft MAPS online community.

step.name: Stop sending file samples to Microsoft MAPS online community.
step.description: Stop sending file samples to Microsoft MAPS online community.

step.name: Forbidding external connections for downloading security intelligence updates
step.description: Forbidding external connections for downloading security intelligence updates

step.name: Turn off enhanced notifications
step.description: Windows Defender Antivirus enhanced notifications will not display on clients.

step.name: Delivery Optimization downloads using HTTP only
step.description: Delivery Optimization downloads using HTTP only

step.name: Do not allow Flip3D invocation
step.description: Enable this policy, Flip 3D is inaccessible.

step.name: Do not allow window animations
step.description: Enable this policy, window animations are turned off.

step.name: Use solid color for Start background
step.description: Enable this policy, Start background will use a solid color.

step.name: Allow edge swipe
step.description: Disable this policy, users will not be able to invoke any system UI by swiping in from any screen edge.

step.name: Disable help tips
step.description: Enable this policy, Windows will not show any help tips to the user.

step.name: Do not show the ´new application installed´ notification
step.description: Do not show the ´new application installed´ notification

step.name: Turn Off Find My Device
step.description: When Find My Device is off, the device and its location are not registered and the Find My Device feature will not work.

step.name: Turn off downloading of game information
step.description: Enable this policy, game information including box art and ratings will not be downloaded.

step.name: Turn off game updates
step.description: Enable this policy, game update information will not be downloaded.

step.name: Turn off tracking of last play time of games in the Games folder
step.description: Enable this policy, the last played time of games will not be recorded in Games folder. This setting only affects the Games folder.

step.name: Prevent the computer from joining a homegroup
step.description: Enable this policy, users cannot add computers to a homegroup. This policy setting does not affect other network sharing features.

step.name: Allow Microsoft services to provide enhanced suggestions as the user types in the Address bar
step.description: Disable this policy, users won't receive enhanced suggestions while typing in the Address bar. In addition, users won't be able to change the Suggestions setting on the Settings charm.

step.name: Disable Periodic Check for Internet Explorer software updates
step.description: Enable this policy, it prevents Internet Explorer from checking to see whether it is the latest available browser version and notifying users if a new version is available.

step.name: Disable showing the splash screen
step.description: Enable this policy, the splash screen, which displays the program name, licensing, and copyright information, is not displayed.

step.name: Install new versions of Internet Explorer automatically
step.description: Disable this policy, automatic upgrade of Internet Explorer will be turned off.

step.name: Prevent participation in the Customer Experience Improvement Program
step.description: Enable this policy, the user cannot participate in the CEIP, and the Customer Feedback Options command does not appear on the Help menu.

step.name: Prevent running First Run wizard
step.description: Enable this policy, Skip the First Run wizard, and go directly to the user's home page.

step.name: Set tab process growth
step.description: Enable this policy, set the rate at which Internet Explorer creates new tab processes to low.

step.name: Specify default behavior for a new tab
step.description: Enable this policy, display the new tab page when the user opens a new tab.

step.name: Turn off add-on performance notifications
step.description: Enable this policy, users are not notified when the average time to load all the user's enabled add-ons exceeds the threshold.

step.name: Turn off browser geolocation
step.description: Enable this policy, browser geolocation support is turned off.

step.name: Turn off Reopen Last Browsing Session
step.description: Enable this policy, the user cannot use the Reopen Last Browsing Session feature.

step.name: Turn off suggestions for all user-installed providers
step.description: Enable this policy, the user cannot view suggestions for user-installed search providers.

step.name: Turn on Suggested Sites
step.description: Disable this policy, the entry points and functionality associated with this feature are turned off.

step.name: Delete Browsing History - Allow deleting browing history on exit
step.description: Enable this policy, deleting browsing history on exit is turned on.

step.name: Internet Settings - Advanced settings - Browsing - Turn off phone number detection
step.description: Enable this policy, phone number detection is turned off. Users won't be able to modify this settin.

step.name: Internet Settings - Advanced settings - Multimedia - Allow Internet Explorer to play media files that use alternative codecs
step.description: Disable this policy, Internet Explorer does not play these files.

step.name: Internet Settings - AutoComplete - Turn off URL Suggestions
step.description: Enable this policy, URL Suggestions will be turned off. Users will not be able to turn on URL Suggestions.

step.name: Internet Settings - AutoComplete - Turn off Windows Search AutoComplete
step.description: Enable this policy, Internet Explorer does not use Windows Search AutoComplete for providing relevant results in the Address bar. The user cannot change this setting.

step.name: Prevent the First Run webpage from opening on Microsoft Edge
step.description: This policy setting lets you decide whether employees see Microsoft´s First Run webpage when opening Microsoft Edge for the first time.

step.name: Prevent managing SmartScreen Filter
step.description: If the user is not prompted to turn on SmartScreen Filter. All website addresses that are not on the filter´s allow list are sent automatically to Microsoft without prompting the user.

step.name: Windows Location Provider - Turn off Windows Location Provider
step.description: Enable this policy, the Windows Location Provider feature will be turned off, and all programs on this computer will not be able to use the Windows Location Provider feature.

step.name: Turn off sensors
step.description: All programs on this computer cannot use the sensor feature.

step.name: Turn off Automatic Download and Update of Map Data
step.description: Enable this policy, the automatic download and update of map data is turned off.

step.name: Turn off unsolicited network traffic on the Offline Maps settings page
step.description: Enable this policy, features that generate network traffic on the Offline Maps settings page are turned off. Note: This may turn off the entire settings page.

step.name: Don't allow Message Service Cloud Sync
step.description: Don't allow backup and restore of cellular text messages to Microsoft´s cloud services.

step.name: Prevent the usage of OneDrive for file storage
step.description: Enable this policy, apps and features can not work with OneDrive file storage.

step.name: Save documents to OneDrive by default
step.description: Disable this policy, files will be saved locally by default.

step.name: Prevent OneDrive network traffic
step.description: Prevent OneDrive from generating network traffic until the user signs in to OneDrive.

step.name: Prevent automatic discovery of feeds and Web Slices
step.description: Enable this policy, the user does not receive a notification on the toolbar that a feed or Web Slice is available.

step.name: Allow Cortana
step.description: Disable this policy, Cortana will be turned off.

step.name: Allow Cortana above lock screen
step.description: Disable this policy, the system will need to be unlocked for the user to interact with Cortana using speech.

step.name: Allow search and Cortana to use location
step.description: Disable this policy, search and Cortana can not access location information.

step.name: Do not allow web search
step.description: Enable this policy, search and Cortana can not access location information.

step.name: Don't search the web or display web results in Search
step.description: Enable this policy, queries won't be performed on the web and web results won't be displayed when a user performs a query in Search.

step.name: Prevent adding UNC locations to index from Control Panel
step.description: Enable this policy, prevents users from adding UNC locations to the index from the Search and Indexing Options in Control Panel.

step.name: Prevent indexing files in offline files cache
step.description: Enable this policy, files on network shares made available offline are not indexed.

step.name: Turn off the offer to update to the latest version of Windows
step.description: Enable this policy, the Store application will not offer updates to the latest version of Windows.

step.name: Turn off Automatic Download of updates
step.description: If you enable this setting, automatic download of updates is turned off.

step.name: Don't allow Automatic Update of Speech Data
step.description: Device will periodically check for updated speech models and then download them from a Microsoft service

step.name: Improve inking and typing recognition
step.description: This policy setting controls the ability to send inking and typing data to Microsoft to improve the language recognition

step.name: Automatically send memory dumps for OS-generated error reports
step.description: Disable this policy, then all memory dumps are uploaded according to the default consent and notification settings.

step.name: Disable Windows Error Reporting
step.description: Enable this policy, Windows Error Reporting does not send any problem information to Microsoft. Additionally, solution information is not available in Security and Maintenance in Control Panel.

step.name: Control maximum size of baseline file cache
step.description: Enable this policy, set the maximum size of the Windows Installer baseline file cache to 5.

step.name: Turn off creation of System Restore checkpoints
step.description: Enable this policy, the Windows Installer does not generate System Restore checkpoints when installing applications.

step.name: Turn off the communities features
step.description: Enable this policy, Windows Mail will not check your newsgroup servers for Communities support.

step.name: Do Not Show First Use Dialog Boxes
step.description: Enable this policy, the anchor window is hidden when the Player is in skin mode.

step.name: Prevent Media Sharing
step.description: Enable this policy, any user on this computer is prevented from sharing digital media content from Windows Media Player with other computers and devices that are on the same network.

step.name: Turn off Windows Mobility Center
step.description: Enable this policy, the user is unable to invoke Windows Mobility Center. The Windows Mobility Center UI is removed from all shell entry points and the .exe file does not launch it.

step.name: Configure Reliability WMI Providers
step.description: Disable this policy, Reliability Monitor will not display system reliability information, and WMI-capable applications will be unable to access reliability information from the listed providers.

step.name: Allow Automatic Updates immediate installation
step.description: Enable this policy, Automatic Updates will immediately install these updates once they are downloaded and ready to install.

step.name: Remove access to use all Windows Update features
step.description: Enable this policy, Windows Update scan access is removed.

step.name: Stop Preview Builds and Feature Updates receiving(1/4)
step.description: Stop Preview Builds and Feature Updates receiving

step.name: Stop Preview Builds and Feature Updates receiving(2/4)
step.description: Stop Preview Builds and Feature Updates receiving

step.name: Stop Preview Builds and Feature Updates receiving(3/4)
step.description: Stop Preview Builds and Feature Updates receiving

step.name: Stop Preview Builds and Feature Updates receiving(4/4)
step.description: Stop Preview Builds and Feature Updates receiving

step.name: Forbidding preview builds installing(1/2)
step.description: It will prevent preview builds from installing on the device

step.name: Forbidding preview builds installing(2/2)
step.description: It will prevent preview builds from installing on the device

step.name: Turn off access to all Windows Update features
step.description: Enable this policy setting, all Windows Update features are removed.

step.name: Do not connect to any Windows Update Internet locations
step.description: This policy applies only when this PC is configured to connect to an intranet update service using the specify intranet Microsoft update service location policy.

step.name: Set wallpaper to solid color for current user
step.description: Set wallpaper to solid color for current user.

step.name: Do not add shares of recently opened documents to Network Locations
step.description: Enable this policy, shared folders are not added to Network Locations automatically when you open a document in the shared folder.

step.name: Active Directory - Maximum size of Active Directory searches
step.description: Enable this policy, set Number of objects returned to 5000.

group.name: Start Menu and Taskbar (Policies for users)
group.description: Start Menu and Taskbar. (Policies for users)

step.name: Clear the recent programs list for new users
step.description: Enable this policy, the recent programs list in the start menu will be blank for each new user.

step.name: Do not display or track items in Jump Lists from remote locations
step.description: Enable this policy, the Start Menu and Taskbar only track the files that the user opens locally on this computer. Files that the user opens over the network from remote computers are not tracked or shown in the Jump Lists. Use this setting to reduce network traffic, particularly over slow network connections.

step.name: Turn off all balloon notifications
step.description: Enable this policy, no notification balloons are shown to the user.

step.name: Turn off user tracking
step.description: Enable this policy, the system does not track the programs that the user runs, and does not display frequently used programs in the Start Menu.

step.name: Notifications - Turn off toast notifications
step.description: Enable this policy, applications will not be able to raise toast notifications.

step.name: Turn off all Windows spotlight features
step.description: Enable this policy, Windows spotlight on lock screen, Windows tips, Microsoft consumer features and other related features will be turned off.

step.name: Turn off caching of thumbnail pictures
step.description: Enable this policy, thumbnail views are not cached.

step.name: Turn off common control and window animations
step.description: Enable this policy, turn off common control and window animations.

step.name: Turn off Thumbnail Previews in File Explorer
step.description: Enable this policy, Disable Thumbnail Previews in File Explorer.

step.name: Turn off display of recent search entries in the File Explorer search box
step.description: Enable this policy, File Explorer will not show suggestion pop-ups as users type into the Search Box, and it will not store Search Box entries into the registry for future references.

step.name: Turn off the caching of thumbnails in hidden thumbs.db file
step.description: Enable this policy, File Explorer does not create, read from, or write to thumbs.db files.

group.name: Improving Login Time
group.description: Improving login time for floating desktops on Horizon View.

step.name: Remove DOTNETFRAMEWORKS Setup
step.description: Remove DOTNETFRAMEWORKS setup from Personalized Settings. Optimize this item will shorten new user first login time.

step.name: Remove Microsoft Internet Explorer ClearIconCache Setup
step.description: Remove Microsoft Internet Explorer ClearIconCache setup from Personlized Settings. Optimize this item will shorten new user first login time.

step.name: Remove Microsoft Internet Explorer Initializer Setup
step.description: Remove Microsoft Internet Explorer Initializer setup from Personalized Settings. Optimize this item will shorten new user first login time.

step.name: Remove Microsoft Outlook MailNews Express Setup
step.description: Remove Microsoft Outlook MailNews Express setup from Personalized Settings. Optimize this item will shorten new user first login time.

step.name: Remove Microsoft Windows Media Player 7 earlier Setup
step.description: Remove Microsoft Windows Media Player 7 earlier setup from Personalized Settings. Optimize this item will shorten new user first login time.

step.name: Remove Microsoft Windows Media Player 7 or later Setup
step.description: Remove Microsoft Windows Media Player 7 or later setup from Personalized Settings. Optimize this item will shorten new user first login time.

step.name: Remove Themes Setup
step.description: Remove Themes setup from Personlized Settings. Optimize this item will shorten new user first login time.

step.name: Remove Windows Desktop Update Setup
step.description: Remove Windows Desktop Update setup from Personalized Settings. Optimize this item will shorten new user first login time.

step.name: Remove All Windows build-in apps(1/2)
step.description: Deletes all removable Universal Windows Platforms Applications except the Windows Store itself.(1/2)

step.name: Remove All Windows build-in apps(2/2)
step.description: Deletes all removable Universal Windows Platforms Applications except the Windows Store itself.(2/2)

group.name: Disable Cache Task
group.description: Disable Cache Task and remove WebCache

step.name: Disable Cache Task(1/3)
step.description: Disable Cache Task and remove WebCache(1/3)

step.name: Disable Cache Task(2/3)
step.description: Disable Cache Task and remove WebCache(2/3)

step.name: Disable Cache Task(3/3)
step.description: Disable Cache Task and remove WebCache(3/3)
